name: FlexShopper, Inc.
description: FlexShopper, Inc. is a leading provider of innovative lease-to-own solutions, enabling consumers to access a wide range of products without the burden of traditional financing. Founded in 2014, the company aims to empower consumers by offering flexible payment options for furniture, electronics, and other household goods. With a strong emphasis on customer service, FlexShopper operates through an online platform where customers can browse a vast inventory of products from various retailers. The company's unique leasing model allows customers to make affordable weekly or monthly payments, providing an alternative to credit cards and high-interest loans. FlexShopper is committed to promoting financial inclusion by providing access to products for those who may not have traditional credit options. The company also partners with a variety of retailers to enhance their customer offerings and boost sales through its lease-to-own programs. With its innovative approach, FlexShopper is transforming the retail landscape and providing consumers with the ability to purchase needed items while managing their budgets effectively.

seo.meta_title: FlexShopper, Inc. | Lease-to-Own Solutions for Consumers
seo.meta_description: Explore FlexShopper, Inc., a leader in lease-to-own solutions. Discover how FlexShopper empowers consumers with flexible payment options for electronics and furniture.

faq.question: What is FlexShopper known for?
faq.answer: FlexShopper is known for its innovative lease-to-own financing solutions that allow consumers to purchase products without traditional credit.

faq.question: Who is the CEO of FlexShopper?
faq.answer: Brad Bernstein is the CEO of FlexShopper, Inc.

faq.question: Where is FlexShopper headquartered?
faq.answer: FlexShopper is headquartered in Delray Beach, Florida, USA.

faq.question: What types of products does FlexShopper offer?
faq.answer: FlexShopper offers a wide range of products including electronics and furniture through its lease-to-own model.
